com.siperian.sif.message.mrm

Class GetAssignedRecordsRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.siperian.sif.message.SiperianRequest
      • com.siperian.sif.message.SiperianObjectRequest
        • com.siperian.sif.message.mrm.GetAssignedRecordsRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SiperianObjectUidProvider, Serializable
    Deprecated. 
    Use Task APIs instead. GetTasksRequest

    public class GetAssignedRecordsRequest
extends SiperianObjectRequest
    Get a set of records requiring manual merge decisions that are assigned to the user.

    Can request records in either the Unmerged or the Onhold state.

    A system parameter determines the maximum number of records to return. Use GetSearchResultsRequest to get subsequent sets of records.

    Required Parameters:

    • SiperianObjectUid - package or base object The primary table of the package must be a base object. This is the object containing the records to be merged.
    • RecordsToReturn - the limit for the number of records that can be returned. See below for information on retrieving large resultsets and paging.
    • RecordState - Determines the state of the records to retrieve: UNMERGED or ON_HOLD.
    • ReturnTotal - When true, the response includes the total number of records in the specified state that are assigned to the user. Setting this parameter to false can increase performance.

    Optional Parameters:

    • setDisablePaging(boolean) - Defaults to false. Disabling the paging mechanism when it is not needed can improve performance of the API.

    Usage Example:

    The following example requests the UNMERGED records for the CUSTOMER_UPDATE package that are assigned to the user making this request.

    GetAssignedRecordsRequest request = new GetAssignedRecordsRequest();
    request.setSiperianObjectUid("PACKAGE.CUSTOMER_UPDATE");
    request.setRecordsToReturn(10);
    request.setRecordState(RecordState.UNMERGED);
    request.setReturnTotal(false);
    GetAssignedRecordsResponse response = (GetAssignedRecordsResponse) sipClient.process(request);

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    API Pair: GetAssignedRecordsResponse

    API Group: Merge Workflow
